phrases.text: Hi, I need help with this.
phrases.usage: Say this politely to get a shop assistant's attention.
phrases.example: Hi, I need help with this small blue radio.

phrases.usage: Use this to explain that the item has damage.
phrases.example: I bought this, but it is broken and unusable.

phrases.usage: Say this when an electronic item will not start.
phrases.example: I tried the battery, but it does not work.

phrases.usage: Ask this if you want a new, working item.
phrases.example: This lamp is cracked. Can I change it for another?

phrases.usage: Ask this if you want your money back instead.
phrases.example: I am unhappy. Can I get a full refund now?

phrases.usage: The shop assistant asks this for proof of purchase.
phrases.example: That is fine. Do you have the paper receipt today?

phrases.usage: Say this while giving the paper proof of purchase.
phrases.example: I found it! Here is the receipt for the shirt.

phrases.text: So I can exchange it, right?
phrases.usage: Use this to confirm you will get a replacement.
phrases.example: So I can exchange it for a new one, right?

keyVocabulary.definition: Something that is in pieces or does not function.
When something is hurt or has a bad mark.
Something that was made wrong and has a problem.
A small piece of paper that shows you paid.
Giving one item back to get a different one.
